DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Blue Dye Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field used to specify information related to the type of blue-colored chemical substances that are used to stain and color other materials during the removal and examination of the sentinel node(s), the first lymph node(s) to which cancer cells are likely to spread from a primary tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Blue Dye Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the removal and examination of the sentinel node(s) (the first lymph node(s) to which cancer cells are likely to spread from a primary tumor), using blue dye, a chemical substance that is used to stain and color other materials, injected into the tumor which is then traced,  via the lymphatic system into the sentinel node.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Property.preferredDefinition: rgb(0, 0, 255):Chemical substances that are used to stain and color other materials. The coloring may or may not be permanent. Dyes can also be used as therapeutic agents and test reagents in medicine and scientific research.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation, whose hue is that of a clear daytime sky.
Agents used to enhance the color or contrast of target materials or samples. Dyes have some affinity for their substrates and are usually applied in a solution.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the assessment performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/23/17 jk added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task; capitalized first word in definition. --- released

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
